articles.title: CPR
articles.content: Cardiopulmonary Resuscitation (CPR) is an urgent life-saving technique used when someone's heart stops beating, indicating cardiac arrest. Immediate action is critical to restore circulation. Steps: 1. Call emergency services immediately. 2. Place hands on the center of the chest. 3. Push hard and fast at 100-120 compressions per minute until help arrives.

articles.title: Choking
articles.content: Choking is a life-threatening emergency when an object blocks the airway, preventing breathing. Quick intervention with the Heimlich maneuver can save a life. Steps: 1. Stand behind the person. 2. Make a fist with one hand and place it above the navel. 3. Grasp with the other hand and press hard with quick upward thrusts until the blockage is cleared.

articles.title: Severe Bleeding
articles.content: Severe bleeding involves rapid, significant blood loss that can lead to shock or death if not controlled immediately. Urgent action is required. Steps: 1. Apply firm, direct pressure to the wound with a clean cloth. 2. Elevate the injured area if possible to slow blood flow. 3. Maintain pressure without stopping until emergency help arrives.

articles.content: A severe burn damages deep skin layers and can cause shock, infection, or death if not treated urgently. Immediate cooling and medical attention are vital. Steps: 1. Call emergency services without delay. 2. Cool the burn with cool (not cold) water for 10-15 minutes. 3. Cover loosely with a clean cloth and avoid applying ointments until help arrives.

Move to a cool, shaded area urgently. 2. Apply cool, wet cloths to the skin and fan the person. 3. Seek medical help if confusion, fainting, or no improvement occurs.
